content.question:
Lactose digestion in E. coli begins with its hydrolysis by the enzyme β-galactosidase. The gene encoding β-galactosidase, lacZ, is part of a coordinately regulated operon containing other genes required for lactose utilization.

Which of the following figures correctly depicts the interactions at the lac operon when lactose is NOT being utilized? (The legend below defines the shapes of the molecules illustrated in the options.)

choices.label: A figure illustrates the flow of promoter, operator, and structural genes. It shows R N A polymerase as a promoter, moving toward operator. The operator is lactose fitted onto the repressor protein. On the right of operator, three structural genes are represented in intervals, labeled as lac Z, lac Y, and lac A.

There is a key with three figures, RNA polymerase is a triangular oval. Repressor Protein is a semicircle with a rectangle missing from the flat side of the semicircle. Lactose is a semicircle that has an additional rectangle protruding from the flat side of the semicircle. Repressor Protein and Lactose are complementary, and create a full circle when they are together.  B) The lac operon with regions in order from left to right: Promoter, Operator, and Structural Genes lac Z, lac Y, and lac A. The Repressor Gene is attached to Lactose, and sitting on the operator.

There is a key with three figures, RNA polymerase is a triangular oval. Repressor Protein is a semicircle with a rectangle missing from the flat side of the semicircle. Lactose is a semicircle that has an additional rectangle protruding from the flat side of the semicircle. Repressor Protein and Lactose are complementary, and create a full circle when they are together.  C) The lac operon with regions in order from left to right: Promoter, Operator, and Structural Genes lac Z, lac Y, and lac A. RNA polymerase is on the operator moving towards the structural genes.

There is a key with three figures, RNA polymerase is a triangular oval. Repressor Protein is a semicircle with a rectangle missing from the flat side of the semicircle. Lactose is a semicircle that has an additional rectangle protruding from the flat side of the semicircle. Repressor Protein and Lactose are complementary, and create a full circle when they are together.  D) The lac operon with regions in order from left to right: Promoter, Operator, and Structural Genes lac Z, lac Y, and lac A.  Repressor protein is stationary on the operator.
